meanings.definition: people who boast or brag excessively
meanings.sent1: The gasconaders at the party wouldn't stop talking about their achievements.
meanings.sent2: She ignored the gasconaders in the group who were constantly talking about themselves.
meanings.sent3: The gasconaders in the office made everyone roll their eyes with their constant bragging.
meanings.sent4: His reputation as a gasconader preceded him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The gasconaders in the town were known for their tall tales and exaggerated stories.

meanings.sent1: He gasconaders about his accomplishments to anyone who will listen.
meanings.sent2: Stop gasconading and just let your actions speak for themselves.
meanings.sent3: She gasconaders so much that no one takes her seriously anymore.
meanings.sent4: His tendency to gasconade often alienates those around him.
meanings.sent5: The politician continued to gasconade about his plans for the future.

meanings.sent1: The gasconaders remarks made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: She had a gasconaders attitude that turned people off.
meanings.sent3: His gasconaders behavior was tiresome to everyone around him.
meanings.sent4: The gasconaders claims were quickly debunked by fact-checkers.
meanings.sent5: The gasconaders tone of his speech was off-putting to the audience.
